aroma.notes: Sweet and roasty like a dessert just popped out of the oven.

acidity.notes: Focused plum juice. A tad too much perhaps, and I taste the 'twangy' note with it. If I swish coffee over my tongue for awhile, I really feel the sandpapery, chalky sensation on my tongue.

sweetness.notes: Mellow, fruit juice kind of sweetness. Cup is just slightly flat but the cool plum note has that 'jewel tone' roundedness that indicates balance with sweetness.

finish.notes: Better than last. Tongue and throat are still a little dry, but no strong 'bad breath' aftertaste.

flavor: First sip screamed 'PLUM JUICE'. Plum note is sweet and round, though also accompanied by the tanginess I associate with astringency. Flavor diminishes as cools.
notes: 7 second swirl bloom with 70g water, fast pour, finished pour at 1:21, swirl tap at 1:39.
actionItem: Interestingly, the drawdown took exactly the same amount of time, but the plum note was noticeably brighter/clearer/glowing. Keep the fast pour (finish at 1:20, s+t at 1:40), but shorten swirl bloom to 6 seconds to make up for old coffee.
